Atwater Street / de Maisonneuve Boulevard[http://www.stm.info/English/metro/Atwater.pdf Atwater Station Neighbourhood Map] |}} '''Atwater''' is a [[metro station|station]] on the [[Line 1 Green (Montreal Metro)|Green Line]] of the [[Montreal Metro|Metro]] [[Rapid transit|rapid transit system]] operated by the [[SociÃ©tÃ© de transport de MontrÃ©al]] (STM). It is located on the border between the city of [[Westmount, Quebec|Westmount]] and the borough of [[Ville-Marie (Montreal)|Ville-Marie]] in [[Montreal]], [[Quebec]], [[Canada]].[http://www.stm.info/English/metro/a-m35.htm Atwater Station] The station opened on October 14, 1966, as part of the original network of the metro; it was the western terminus of the Green Line until the extension to [[Angrignon (Montreal Metro)|Angrignon]] in 1978. [[File:Ãdicule Atwater.jpg|thumb|left|300px|Station entrance on the southeasterly corner of Atwater Avenue and Saint Catherine Street]] {{clear left}} == Architecture and art == Designed by David, Boulva et Cleve, it is a normal [[side platform]] station, built in [[Tunnel#Cut-and-cover|open cut]] under the [[De Maisonneuve Boulevard]]. It has a large [[Mezzanine (architecture)|mezzanine]] with ticket barriers on either end. It has [[Underground City, Montreal|underground city]] connections to the [[Place Alexis Nihon]], [[Westmount Square]], and [[Dawson College]]. The station is equipped with the MÃ©troVision information screens which displays news, commercials, and the time till the next train. ==Origin of the name== This station is named for [[Atwater Avenue]], named for [[Edwin Atwater]] (1808–1874), a municipal alderman of the district of Saint-Antoine. The street was named for him in 1871. ==Connecting bus routes== {{Main|List of Montreal Bus Routes}}
